page.title: 19Transport links, Rutland
page.content: Two factors are combining to link the study area with the Midland towns to the west (e.g. Leicester and Birmingham) and East Anglia. Firstly there has been the construction of the new by-pass. Secondly there is to be a re-alignment of Wardley Hill on the A47 just to the west of the area. Wardley Hill is currently a long, winding hill which generally retards the flow of heavy goods vehicles and in winter sometimes stops it completely. The Rutland District Council is currently looking for potential industrial development sites in th Uppingham area, especially between the town and the by-pass. { The Rutland and Stamford Mercury of 18 October 1985 reported an application for planning permission for a Happy Eater restaurant at the A47/A6003 roundabout.
